fields.name: Test for resource takeover
fields.summary:
In a common case you need to check, that something (DNS record, website link) is still pointing to an existing resource (NS serve, social network profile, IP address). 
If something is pointing to non--existing resource and you can register it - your resource is vulnerable to takeover attack.

Steps to reproduce (Social network example):

1. Visit your website
2. Follow social network links

Expected result: 

* All social network profiles exist


Steps to reproduce (DNS record):

1. Execute the following command in terminal: `dig yourdnsrecord.com NS`
2. Execute the following command in terminal: `dig yourdnsrecord.com CNAME`


Expected result: 

* There is no NXDOMAIN/SERVFAIL status
fields.summary_en:
In a common case you need to check, that something (DNS record, website link) is still pointing to an existing resource (NS serve, social network profile, IP address). 
If something is pointing to non--existing resource and you can register it - your resource is vulnerable to takeover attack.

Steps to reproduce (Social network example):

1. Visit your website
2. Follow social network links

Expected result: 

* All social network profiles exist


Steps to reproduce (DNS record):

1. Execute the following command in terminal: `dig yourdnsrecord.com NS`
2. Execute the following command in terminal: `dig yourdnsrecord.com CNAME`


Expected result: 

* There is no NXDOMAIN/SERVFAIL status
fields.summary_ru:
В общем случае вам нужно проверить, что ваш ресурс (запись DNS, ссылка на веб-сайт) все еще указывает на существующий ресурс (сервер NS, профиль социальной сети, IP-адрес).
Если ваш ресурс указывает на несуществующий ресурс и вы можете его зарегистрировать - ваш ресурс уязвим для угона.

Шаги для воспроизведения (пример социальной сети):

1. Посетите свой веб-сайт с браузера.
2. Переходите по ссылкам на социальные сети.

Ожидаемый результат:

* Существуют все профили в социальных сетях


Шаги для воспроизведения (запись DNS):

1. Выполните в терминале следующую команду: `dig yourdnsrecord.com NS`
2. Выполните в терминале следующую команду: `dig yourdnsrecord.com CNAME`


Ожидаемый результат:

* Нет статуса NXDOMAIN / SERVFAIL

fields.title: Strict server-side control
fields.title_en: Strict server-side control
fields.title_ru: Строгий контроль на стороне бэкенда
fields.summary:
All client-side data checks must be duplicated on the server side.
The frontend is not considered trusted at all.
Applies to **any security mechanism**.

**Example of over-trusting the client**:
Client -> Server: User makes a payment and sends `amount=1$` for apple

**Problem**:
The server does not check the real value of the item and can be fooled by an attacker

**Fix example**:
Client -> Server: User makes a payment and sends `transactionid=1kj3g421jk6gf235hg6fj253hg6j235`
Server -> Client: Apple costs $100, not $1

fields.title: Test for resource takeover
fields.title_en: Test for resource takeover
fields.title_ru: Тест на угон ресурса
fields.text:
In a common case you need to check, that something (DNS record, website link) is still pointing to an existing resource (NS serve, social network profile, IP address).
If something is pointing to non - existing resource and you can register it - your resource is vulnerable to takeover attack.

Steps to reproduce (Social network example):

1. Visit your website
2. Follow social network links

Expected result:

* All social network profiles exist


Steps to reproduce (DNS record):

1. Execute the following command in terminal: `dig yourdnsrecord.com NS`
2. Execute the following command in terminal: `dig yourdnsrecord.com CNAME`


Expected result:

* There is no NXDOMAIN / SERVFAIL status
